newss.title: Spoke and Word — Episode 2 — Predicting the Apollo 11 Launch, an Iron Maiden Toilet and Mark Mulville.
newss.description:
While pedaling the 2nd longest continuous sidewalk in the US, Matt Coplon digs deep with Mark Mulville tying in how a 19th century French author who predicted the Apollo 11 launch, a performance artist who handcrafted an Iron Maiden toilet, and a state that delivers 230 days of sunshine (and rain), has helped inspire Mark Mulville and his trail riding over the course of 30 years.

Thanks for coming along for the ride; We hope you enjoy.

Filmed and Edited by Dan Dellorso of Dellorso Visuals.

Artwork and Logo by Adi Gilbert.

Created by Matt Coplon.

Music: “Out of View” by Guiltmaker.

Guest rider: Lucas Porzio.

Special guest: @princemidnightx

Brought to you by Profile Racing and Radshare.

PS. We had some audio issues during the interview portion which we could not fix, apologies on the crackling.

newss.title: Chur the Dogs — The Halahans in NZ — Profile Bmx + Dig Bmx
newss.description: Last winter, brothers Lukas and Nate Halahan took a journey to New Zealand and shred the incredible Pegasus and PMP trails with Nathan Saunders and locals, as well as a few concrete gems around Middle Earth. Filmed by the homies Nathan Saunders, Jake Krebs, Jay Riddle, and Logan Haynes.

newss.title: From Dawn till Dusk — Big Island Vibes — Jared Eberwein
newss.description:
My family and I have been travelling to the Hawaiian Islands annually, the Big Island to be precise, but this holiday family vacation was a little different. I brought my bike to devote one day, solely to riding. The day’s itinerary was planned, and highly motivated by my good friend Daniel Chambers. With one day to make the most of it, that’s exactly what happened; From dawn till dusk, and to the point where everyone was spent. Thanks to Ryan Seifried who’s paradise of dirt jumps, sculpted into a beautiful front/side yard (from a BMX’ers POV) and including a hybrid of wood ramps and a perfect cement quarter for some added fun, began the session.

The day was capped off with a sprinkling of skateparks and some unexpected rain, which detoured us to a quick flatland spot just before ending at the last skatepark. It was perfect timing for an incredible end-of-day sunset. Thanks to all the locals that came out (even some travelling from other islands) to enjoy the session with me; You truly made it an amazing day and I’m so grateful for the new friendships created and the memories made. Being able to film/edit this video was the icing on cake.

Thank you!

— Jared Eberwein —

newss.title: Spoke and Word — Episode One — How to pedal from Tampa to Cuba or A Cigar City in your backyard.
newss.description:
Spoke and Word, hosted by Matt Coplon.

Brought to you by Profile Racing and Radshare.

For anyone who has ridden a bmx bike, the initial journey always starts right outside your front door.

The sound of your tires crunching asphalt is hard to disassociate from what you experience while pedaling; your town’s unique flora and fauna, it’s architecture and history, and those conversations you have with friends, the camaraderie that was begun on two wheels, and those connections that could very well last a lifetime.

Profile’s Freestyle Team Manager, Matt Coplon, takes you on a pedaling experience through his home state of Florida. To reminisce on the things, behind the things, that we all have experienced while pedaling.

Spoke and Word’s first Season will be a total of 8 episodes and will include rides/Interviews with Profile’s Dr. Luis Pinzon (The Owl’s Nest and Emergency Medicine), Mark Mulville (Florida Trails History, Rocket Photography, and the second longest continuous sidewalk in the US), and Chad Degroot (his connections to Florida all while traversing through Everglades National Park).

And, of course, each episode will end as a session with the crew at the local, to finish a perfect day of riding.

We hope you enjoy the journey, but more importantly, we hope it motivates YOU to get outside and discover it yourself.

———————————-

Filmed and Edited by Dan Dellorso of Dellorso Visuals.

Artwork and Logo by Adi Gilbert.

Created by Matt Coplon.

Brought to you by:

Profile Racing — www.profileracing.com

Radshare — www.radshare.org

RADshare is a non-profit organization dedicated to educating and empowering local youth: to reach their full potential through inclusive community-based projects that explore and celebrate the art of having fun.

—————————————

Spoke and Word — Episode One — How to pedal from Tampa to Cuba or A Cigar City in your backyard.

Inspired by years of solo pedaling/searching for street spots through his immediate neighborhood, Matt Coplon walks out of his front door to pedal a 16 mile loop through his beloved City of Tampa .

From discovering a massive, historic Camphor tree, to dodging a chicken siesta, all while en route to pedal to Cuba without a passport…this episode ends with a session at the historic Bowl in Downtown Tampa.

Thanks for coming along for the ride; We hope you enjoy.

newss.title: 1600 Miles to Saskatoon — Andrew Lazaruk + Carson Donovan — Timeless Bmx Distro
newss.description:
1600 Miles to Saskatoon — Timeless Bmx Distro x Profile Bmx

The main purpose of the trip was to get out to Saskatoon, Saskatchewan for the 8th annual Brett Craig memorial jam put on by Doug’s Spoke N Sport.
I wanted to get Timeless more involved with that event this year and make it out there in person. I decided to make a road trip out of it and try to ride a few parks along the way. There wasn’t much of an agenda aside from making sure we were there for the day of the jam. It’s a decent drive (13 hours-ish), so I planned for a couple extra days on the way out to be able to stop and ride some parks but doing so meant we would have to drive straight back on the way home.

Alex Fenning and I headed out from Kelowna early one morning and met up with Carson Donovan in Cochrane, Alberta and got a session in at the park there before staying the night in Calgary. The next day, we checked out a couple other Alberta skateparks before making our way further east to Saskatoon. Having made it to the destination a day before the jam, we had time to check out a few Saskatchewan parks before we ended up getting rained out later on in that afternoon. The jam itself was amazing! So stoked we were able to make it out there for it, already looking forward to next year.

Big thanks to Kelly Bragg and the rest of the guys from the bike shop for putting the event on. Headed out early the next morning to make our way back to British Columbia. Have to give a huge shout out to Seth Varga for the accommodations in Saskatoon, Seth rules and is a big part of the scene out there!
Can’t wait to head back out!

-Andrew Lazaruk

Song: “Mechanical sounds cascaded through the city walls and everyone revelled in their ignorance” by Red Sparrows.
Filmed by Alex Fenning.
Artwork by Dave Long.

newss.title: Callsign Carolina Gallery — Dig Bmx — Snaps by Dan Dellorso
newss.description:
The machinations of any road trip with the Profile crew takes quite a bit of time.
Aligning work vs. vacation vs. seasonal windows vs. host’s schedules; we try and try until the stars finally align.
After multiple delays, the summer of 2023 became the convergence date; albeit just 3 total days to make things happen.
Like many of our crew’s road trips, there is no set plan and there is no set filmer.
We hit spots together with no preconceived notions, rather let the session create the vibe and have the chips fall where they lay.
Thanks to Dig Bmx for hosting Dan Dellorso’s photo gallery from our trip.
Check it:
https://digbmx.com/photo-ops/callsign-carolina-photo-journal-profile

newss.title: Weather it Ain’t — Chased by rain in Richmond — The Leepers, Dellorso, and Tylee.
newss.description:
“The day before we left for Profile’s “Callsign Carolina” trip, Dan Dellorso had an early flight into Richmond, Virginia where we spent the whole day getting chased by rain.

An 80% chance all day; It actually rained at every spot, but somehow, never enough the stick.

From North Richmond, to South Richmond and back; Sessions with Dillon Leeper, Shane Leeper, Craig Welch, Dre Tylee, and Dan Dellorso.”

-Profile

Profile’s Callsign Carolina Edit.
newss.description:
“The machinations of any road trip with the Profile crew takes quite a bit of time. Aligning work vs. vacation vs. seasonal windows vs. host’s schedules; we try and try until the stars finally align. Our good friend, Dave Long, initiated the invite to host our crew a year ago. After multiple delays, the summer of 2023 became the convergence date; albeit just 3 total days to make things happen. Like many of our crew’s road trips, there is no set plan and there is no set filmer. We hit spots together with no preconceived notions, rather let the session create the vibe and have the chips fall where they lay. This is our collaborative collection of 72 hours in Dave’s neck of the woods. Shout out to him for being the host with the most, for being our guide, and for creating the title and theme based around the overarching coalescence of both the military and civilian cultures in his local area. We hope you enjoy.”

-Profile

Callsign Carolina is Dillon Leeper, Dan Dellorso, Mark Mulville, Kent Pearson, Dave Long, Neal Cart, Shane Leeper, and Dre Tylee.

newss.title: Points of Engagement. Profile’s 55th anniversary: A crew mixer. (Section 3)
newss.description:
Points of Engagement. Profile’s 55th anniversary: A crew mixer.

(originally featured on www.digbmx.com)

For Profile’s 55th Anniversary, we wanted to do a mixer with our crew. Back in November of 2022, we asked everyone to send in a couple clips that they were stoked on. The parameters; filmed on anything as long as it was landscape and 1080P. Expecting a ten minute mixer, it proved to be an hour and ten minutes of footage narrowed down to this final, half hour piece titled “Points of Engagement”: An homage to our decades of hub production, as well as the connection we have with each of our riders. (Thanks to Cory Foust for the name). We wanted to thank everyone who was able to contribute, and thank them for their continued support of what we do here in this machine shop in St. Pete, Florida. We’re so thankful and honored to have them on board. A huge thank you to our distros worldwide who help us support our extended family; Profile Europe (UK), Country Bikes (Germany), Timeless (Canada), Republica (Colombia), Elite (Australia), SNAP (UK), ABP (France)… And thank you for watching…We hope this brings as much stoke to you as it did for us when putting it together. Enjoy.

This project is dedicated to Craig Stevens. We love and miss you, Craig…may your infectious energy live on forever. -Matt Coplon / Profile Racing

——–

Section Three: Chad Degroot – Filmed by Chaz Dillon and Jona Jahchan, edited by Jona Jahchan. Greg Illingworth – Filmed by Ike Duly. Bobby Proctor – Filmed and edited by Chris Childs. Billy Woodfin – Filmed by Ryan Howard. Phil Aller – Filmed by Matt Nicklen / Tripod. Dylan Kakowski – Filmed by Zack Ozment and M.C. Karl Poynter – Filmed by Andy Sizemore.

newss.title: Rise and Grind — Mr. Bikes and Boards — Supported by Profile Racing
newss.description:
RISE N GRIND was awesome. Started with a simple idea from Jeff “Grandpa” Melis to provide cold brew coffee.

Toss some cold night before pizzas and we have a Sunday morning event.

Didn’t know the amount of people that would show up. Had to improvise and do a jam.

We call this freestyle.

1-high air

2-mannie pad

3-fun box n rail

4-hip

5-barcelona uneven ledges

6-infinity quarter

7-time trials.

Loved very minute of it. Expected 20x and over 60x attended. Florida overheated my @chaddegroot phone for the @profile_racing LIVE feed but @luke.bellows.1 took the win for the 6x video parts he filmed. Shout out to the original idea @jeff__melis cold brew @mrbikesnboards cold pizza and @profile_racing / @decobmx09 goods.

Big shouts to @jmedina86 on the mic.

Awesome seeing @adrian_arnaiz roll up in his wheelchair.

THANK YOU. Let’s keep #BMX awesome.

newss.title: Abacoa Jam — July 26th — Jupiter, Florida.
Terry Adams — Today I’m 40.
newss.description:
Today I’m 40 and I’ve never been so grateful to be alive on my birthday.

Four years ago I looked at myself in the mirror and I didn’t like what I saw. I had let myself go. I was eating all the wrong shit, I never worked out, and my riding was starting to suffer. I was heading down the wrong path. I told myself in that moment, my goal was to get in the best shape of my life before I turned 40. I didn’t wait until Monday to start.. I walked out my house and started running. I’m stoked on what I accomplished, but there’s more work to be done. I look forward to continuing the journey and I’m excited about the remaining years of my life. I’ll never truly be able to explain the amount of work I did to get where I’m at today.

–Terry Adams

newss.description:
Amongst filming for the Profile “Postcards from Ohio” feature (in collab with Dig Bmx), our crew had a session at Animal HQ.

Clips of Billy Woodfin, Shane Leeper, Dan Conway, and Dillon Leeper.
Filmed and edited by Ryan Howard.
Thanks again to Ryan for the hospitality.

newss.title: Finale — Heresy Bmx
newss.description:
Profile proudly sponsors the Heresy Team:

“Heldenplatz has been my second home since I moved to Vienna 2000. Unfortunately the spot will be reconstructed and from what we know it won’t be rideable anymore. It hurts.
I spent the past months filming my last clips there. Now it’s over. It’s time to move on. It’s alright.”

-Sebastian.

Riding: Sebastian Grubinger
Filming: Sebastian Grubinger
Edit: Sevisual

Vienna, 2022 – 2023.

Mickey Gaidos with a dialed unboxing of his Profile ZCoaster/Mini wheel

So good!
We appreciate you, Mickey!

newss.title: In The Cut — Postcards from Ohio — Outtakes — Dig Bmx
newss.description: Some behind the scenes action from Profile Racing’s “Postcards From Ohio” edit, with Billy Woodfin, Dan Conway, Dillon and Shane Leeper.

newss.title: Possibly the most popular stem in Bmx? Still PUSHin’ — Mark Mulville and the Profile Push Stem.
newss.description:
“At the end of 2008, Mark Mulville sketched a rudimentary design on a napkin. He brought that napkin into the Profile machine shop and within a week, the Profile 40 load stem, now discontinued, was modified into a top load design that would, soon after, get the moniker “The Profile Push Stem.” Coming on 15 years old, Mulville’s Push stem quickly became, and has remained, one of Profile’s most popular products. Recently, Stew Johnson interviewed Mark at his local trail spot in East Florida.

Here’s what they captured: Still PUSHin’, Mulville’s Push stem, past, present and future.”

– Matt Coplon

Filmed and edited by Stew Johnson.

Originally released in collaboration with Dig Bmx.

Song: “Stranger Things” by Drifting Roots.

newss.title: The Hang Five Podcast with Chad Degroot
newss.description:
Where do I start? My guest this time around has been riding since the mid 80s and done it all: Park, street, dirt and of course Flatland for which is most renowned.
Growing up in the midwest us, He is the winner of 3 Flatland NORA cups, he was named one of the most influencial riders by Ride BMX Magazine, he is one of the founding members of BACO, He has owned skateparks, a bike shop and of course DECO BMX.

This is the story of Chad Degroot!

https://www.buzzsprout.com/1164767/13177402

newss.title: The Rowan Roast — Fayetteville, Nc.
newss.description:
During the last day of a Profile Roadtrip to Fayetteville, our crew met up with Dave Long and a good amount of the NC. crew to celebrate the 3rd annual Rowan Roast.

As Dave explains, The Rowan Roast is meant to get riders to take a break from their schedules every other month, come together and have a session. Thanks to everyone who attended, and thanks to Dave Long for hosting.

Filmed by Matt Coplon, Dan Dellorso, Mark Mulville, and Dave Long. Animation by Dave Long.

newss.title: Profile PA Crawl with Conway, The Leepers, Tylee and Zovko.
newss.description:
Profile’s PA Neighborhood Crawl The 5th in the PROFILE Neighborhood Crawl series.

The crew stationed themselves in Upper Chichester Township (PA, USA), where Dan Conway lead the charge navigating all of his “local” spots.

Filmed through Upland PA, Quakertown PA, Lansdale Pa, West Chester PA, Aston PA, and Wilmington DE.

Mind you, no session was above 34 degrees.

A group filming/session effort by Dillon leeper, Dre Tylee, Shane Leeper, Dave Zovko, and Dan Conway.

Edited by Dan Conway and Matt Coplon.

Music Bongripper – ENDLESS

newss.title: The Return of the Profile Whippit Sprocket
newss.description:
For years, we’ve been getting requests to do a re-up of our Iconic, mid school sprocket: The Profile Whippit.

Finally, we have an open machine to set those in motion…

Sprocket Blanks prepped and ready.

Making its debut in 1996, the Profile Whippit was the last sprocket we had in production before things shifted to much more ornate designs; Ie. the Profile Imperial, Flywheel, Inferno, Fireball, and Blackjack.

The 2001 Profile Catalogue; The last year of Whippit production.

Production has started, and once the sprockets are done, they will be heading out to get high polished and should be available in the next 6 weeks.

Sizes available; 36, 39, and 44t.

Production in motion…

newss.title: Inside Profile Racing — Cog Lock Rings
newss.description:
Our “Inside Profile Racing” series offers a quick glance into the very small parts that are often time consuming, that make up our components line.

This episode covers the manufacturing go our Cog Lock Rings for our Elite, Mini, and Elite MTB cassette hub, cog drivers.

Thanks for your continued support of Profile Racing.
